qas.question: Along with Walt Disney, who created Oswald the Lucky Rabbit?
Who owned the rights to Oswald?
Who produced an Oswald the Lucky Rabbit motion picture?
What character did Walt Disney create in 1928?
What was the first animated short with synchronized sound?
Who owned the rights to Oswald the Rabbit?
Who created Oswald with Ib Uwerks?
Who was created in 1829 by Disney and Iwerks?
What was the first 1982 animated short?
What was Walt Disney a minor player in?

context: <a1_0><b5_0>Universal<b5_0/><a1_0/> owned the rights to the "Oswald the Lucky Rabbit" character, although <b6_0>Walt Disney<b6_0/> and <a0_0>Ub Iwerks<a0_0/> had created Oswald, and their films had enjoyed a successful theatrical run. After <a2_0>Charles Mintz<a2_0/> had unsuccessfully demanded that Disney accept a lower fee for producing the property, Mintz produced the films with his own group of animators. Instead, Disney and Iwerks created <a3_0><b7_0>Mickey Mouse<b7_0/><a3_0/> who in 1928 stared in the first "sync" sound animated short, <a4_0><b8_0>Steamboat Willie<b8_0/><a4_0/>. This moment effectively launched Walt Disney Studios' foothold, while Universal became a minor player in <b9_0>film animation<b9_0/>. Universal subsequently severed its link to Mintz and formed its own in-house animation studio to produce Oswald cartoons headed by Walter Lantz.
